newsitem.title: ANGOLA: Angolan government lowers national fuel prices.
newsitem.headline: Angolan government lowers national fuel prices.

text.p: The Angolan government on Wednesday lowered national fuel prices and fixed the pump price for petrol at 100,000 kwanzas per litre, three days after increasing it to 130,000 kwanzas.

"This step is necessary to revive the mechanisms for the formation of prices to the public of petroleum products," state news agency Angop quoted a statement from Finance Minister Mario Monteiro, who authorised the changes.
"These prices will stay suspended until the conclusion of necessary studies," he said.
Petrol prices have risen in oil-rich Angola since May 1996, when the price was 1,870 kwanzas per litre.
Fuel is heavily subsidised by the government, but Western ecnomists said the increases in petrol were necessary to help increase the budget revenue.
In spite of the latest prices, petrol remains cheaper in Angola than a litre of mineral water, which costs between 200,000 kwanzas on the informal market and 600,000 kwanzas in restaurants.
An economist said Wednesday's sudden adjustment in fuel prices was due to public pressure.

"Even though petrol remains cheaper than water, milk or sugar, salaries are very low and any increase, especially in fuel, is hard on the pocket of any Angolan. I believe the government was pressurised to lower the price," he said.
